tweet: Proud to work with @SenDuckworth & @GovPritzker to help IL SNAP recipients buy groceries online. When will Senator McConnell feel the ‘urgency’ to act on #COVID19 legislation? 90,000+ Americans have died & the Senate Majority Leader’s focus is on protecting corporations from accountability.

Our next @USNavy Secretary must prioritize the well-being of our sailors, including those at @navstaglakes, & take steps toward mitigating health risks brought on by #COVID19. Spoke with Amb. Kenneth Braithwaite, @USNavy Secretary nominee, about his thoughts on these issues.

Going to the Senate floor this morning to call on my colleagues to support the #HeroesAct. With 92,000+ Americans dead, more than 1.5M sick w/#COVID19, & 36.5M more unemployed, it's hard to imagine how Senate Republicans don’t feel any urgency to act. https://t.co/B0T9RuMcaP

Sen McConnell should pay attention to what’s happening in his own state per his own Gov.

The #HeroesAct provides necessary funds for struggling state & local govts & hospitals, like in KY, to prevent layoffs for first responders, doctors, nurses & teachers.
 
Seems urgent to me. https://t.co/HOaRPPApfn

Spoke w/@toendhunger today about the spike in SNAP applications & food bank lines & ways we can work together to feed families. Helping hungry Americans & the world's most vulnerable isn't just the right thing to do – it will be necessity for us to fully recover from this crisis.

Across the US, state unemployment agencies are overwhelmed by the unprecedented number of claims filed by working families trying to make ends meet. These state agencies must be equipped to process & deliver unemployment benefits to Americans as quickly as possible.
